title: Missing write coalescing

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Function `make_constant()` writes a constant to `S`. Optimally it would be a single 16-byte write to memory, but in fact it generates four separate writes. Function `make()` writes a nonconstant and a constant. Ideally it would generate two writes (one nonconstant, one constant), or perhaps an OR followed by a single write. Instead, it also generates four writes.

```asm
playground::make:
	movq	%rdi, %rax
	movq	%rsi, (%rdi)
	movb	$1, 8(%rdi)
	movl	$0, 9(%rdi)
	movl	$0, 12(%rdi)
	retq

playground::make_constant:
	movq	%rdi, %rax
	movq	$5, (%rdi)
	movb	$1, 8(%rdi)
	movl	$0, 9(%rdi)
	movl	$0, 12(%rdi)
	retq
```

```rust
pub struct S(u64, bool, [u8; 7]);

pub fn make(x: u64) -> S {
    S(x, true, [0; 7])
}

pub fn make_constant() -> S {
    S(5, true, [0; 7])
}
```

([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=release&edition=2018&gist=66237b264939df6f7670b6398c60fdd1))
